WGTOhiDSv4FTvj2xovwNFQ.text: Iran restaurant is fairly small, and six of us arrived at around 20:00 on a Saturday night, but we were able to be seated almost immediately outside. It's located on a very small street so the seating arrangement was cozy, but comfortable. The staff was very attentive and helpful. We had several starters and I ordered the lamb curry dish. It was all absolutely delicious! I personally am not very familiar with Iranian food, but some of our party was quite knowledgable about the cuisine and confirmed its authenticity. Everyone at our table agreed that their dishes were phenomenal. I had a great experience!

7FZVCOhT0N5xKsaQ4FyCQQ.text: Hospitality, good food and beautiful surrounding with attentive service- what more could you ask for!  Truly authentic. The heaters outside (even one under the table to keep your legs warm) is a delightful touch. I came with my elderly parents and the beautiful and cozy outdoor surroundings, even on a cool night , madeThem want to just stay there and enjoy

d_AcGRfkK-qOhBCehvhukg.text: We had one of the most memorable and delicious Persian dinner of our lives here! This restaurant brought us a flood of memories of Iran and the food we grew up on. Everything was fresh and homemade! We ordered the fesenjoon and the special kebab and it was perfectly done. Very authentic Iranian cuisine! Bravo! Love this place and can not wait to return!

5UIPYPIiE3kpyW6C6LE7Kw.text: Stopped in London, for one of our many stops on the family trip- we're traveling from the US, stopped in Canada, now through Europe, then ending in Thailand. Being Iranian, we tend to crave kabob often, so we make it a point to seek out the best Iranian food in town (if it exists). We found it! Truly some of the best Iranian food I've had (no offense to my grandma). For appetizers, the four of us shared fresh bread and yogurt with shallots, and yogurt with cucumber. For entrees we had koobideh, barg, and the salmon entree. For the finish we had tea and baklava. Very delicious food and wonderful service, met with the most beautiful day on a cozy little street. I would definitely recommend and next time I'm back in London I'll be sure to return. Kheyli mam noon!

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Perfect ending to the meal
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Entrees

yJP1FXCP7ackLq8sBaN5YA.text: It is  perfect. Food and staff are amazing. Az an Iranian I can compare quality to best of restaurants in the country.

6MPjSkiAu1UQqlEeEKsOtg.text: Excellent food and service. New to Persian food but the owner and staff were extremely helpful in helping us order our meal . Best food I've had even i the U.S. Highly recommend this restaurant , it lived up to all the positive reviews. My wife and I will be back!!

1pHzGo3cgKn2sSXKX_FP_Q.text: One of the best meals I had in London.  Truly excellent.  Everything was great, but don't miss the Babaganoush -- possible the best I've ever had.

yofHPJyTHFKXuiCog96CuA.text: Amazing Iranian food. Authentic stuff from Iran! Juicy kabobs and very nice service. Also love the location, right in Mayfair and on a cute street. I highly recommend this place!

gZdXzo0NzGjv6mI0nm2JQQ.text: Best hummus I have ever tried! Amazing food and great atmosphere! Everyone was very nice and service was amazing!

Q8hbbPgA4PweQqwRKsL6Qg.text: We stopped at the Iran Restaurant while walking around the tourist attractions in the area. We saw some good reviews, so had decent expectations-- all of which were exceeded! The service was excellent; the owner was there and we felt like we were treated like VIPs. The food was exceptional and the portions sizes were generous. We had questions about the cuisine and they were very helpful to select food we would enjoy. We thought the food was extremely reasonably priced, especially for the neighborhood. We'll definitely be back on our next visit to London.

0da7kKMFLHqYCripWAhzZg.text: The service and the food were excellent at Iran Resturant. From what I understand that location has been around for thirty five years. My kids loved it so as my wife. The kabobs were very tasty. We all loved it. I would go back again. There is something to say about this establishment being around for that many years and getting good marks all the time. I would go back in a hart beat.

fRNSrXDZxnzyLUyTDxaxuw.text: Great food , fantastic hospitality ... loved every bit of it !! Try the mixed grill .. the flavours are fantastic !! The owner himself helps you to choose the right dish , quite an amazing guy..

TguQ8TdNakCGjcbYdzFLHw.text: We stopped by here for dinner during a recent trip to London, mainly because we had seen that the restaurant received top reviews online. We were absolutely not disappointed, and this was one of the best meals we had in London. The food was absolutely delicious--we got a family platter of assorted meats for the two of us and left completely stuffed. The restaurant is located on a charming side street. The servers were incredibly kind and welcoming. Could not have asked for better service or better food. The fresh baked bread they provide at the beginning of the meal was a true delight. Will definitely be back to eat at this restaurant when we are in London again!

6eFn3gYQxSztUpNZe4xoUQ.text: Excellent restaurant. Food was so delicious. There are many restaurants in shepherds market but so happy we chose this one. The owner, Javad welcomed us kindly with his warm hospitality and delicious recommendations. He's been in business for 35 years! I had the salmon as my main and my boyfriend had the mixed grill. We were given two types of rice one was greenish with lentils and I think it also had olives-OMG I never had this type of rice but it was soooo good. Also loved the lentil soup, the hummus and the shirazi salad. The bread is served warm from a clay oven that the owner imported from Iran!  We finished with traditional iranian tea and baklava and Javad was kind enough to give me some tea to take home so i can make it myself! Highly recommend this place for ambiance, great  original Iranian cuisine, and such kind and welcoming hospitality. In a city where good food and service is hard to come by, Iran restaurant wins in all categories and I will definitely be making this place one of my to go to places.

7hsGYcDNG-LpJotLOgsvzw.text: The hubs and I went here tonight. We don't normally go to middle eastern restaurants. The hubs is partial to Tex Mex and I like Asian or Italian. The food was excellent. The waiter brought a few extra dishes for tasting. The service staff was attentive, but not annoying. We had a surprisingly great meal and would definitely recommend. I had a vegetarian dish and my husband had the mixed grilled kabab. For starts we had the hummus - delicious. We also had a few glasses of red wine that complemented the meal perfectly.

OWzoVFSNX3kZZHOvuhrQ8A.text: Service was a bit slow but we didnt mind.  Food was out of this world, and we loved the outdoor seating.  If you are looking for a relaxed dinner def check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

jjLB6G9e9apwi6UwL8_OwA.text: I went to that place with a group of friends because the Lebanese restaurant nearby was full. The service was not impressive (we ordered some bread that never showed up), the starters were okay but unfortunately the main courses was simply not great. It's a shame to get a plate full of rice when you ordered a meat dish. It's even worse when the meat is of low quality.Ironically, I was impressed when they asked me how I wanted my lamb chops cooked and a bit worried that I said rare because I remembered that rare lamb chops are fairly hard to eat. They happened to be well done...

r2lvc3L6qQTHZ0obIpb6xg.text: Authentic little gem in London. Food was incredible as close as home cook Persian meal. Amazing food and owner was very hospitable.. A must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

pa8qQPwIVNjVTZlibQbnSA.text: We were there at the end of May, so my review is coming in a little late, but oyyyyyy, this place is AMAZING! I grew up on Persian food, and my family used to go out to various Persian restaurants every Sunday growing up (across the pond, in California), but this is as good as it gets. Friendly service, family run, MOUTH WATERINGLY DELICIOUS. They have a tandoor in house so their Persian flatbread is made FRESH, and every dish we had was cooked to perfection. The owner seemed genuinely grateful for each and every customer, and we had a wonderful conversation with him. The restaurant is beautiful and the decor makes you feel like you're in Tehran. To top off our fantastic experience, they even brought us out complimentary hummus! If only we lived in London so we could eat here all the time...

iuIxFTzT5Td7vNAtXJ0_8w.text: We thought Iran was amazing! The salmon meal as well as the basic chicken kabob were wonderful, bu the experience was made all the better by our awesome server Mohammed. We Will definitely be back, oh and don't forget the baklava for dessert!

iagUxeT9g21Eg7WKqe3phA.text: If I could leave 6 stars I would. What an amazing restaurant with a most gracious host. Excellent food and was treated just like family. I would go out of my way again just to find this place. I think you'll be amazed by the food and by the care that they show their customers.

PMlIJ18vpOmHdmCQfpxKjw.text: The food is good but we had an extremely bad service! The old man who I think is the owner of the place was truly horrible! He let us set and after 15 minutes brought the menus then when we ordered they didn't serve the food for 20 minutes, they didn't bring all the food we ordered! They didn't bring bread even when we asked! The same old man was checking on the other table next to us several times and completely ignored us!!When we complained about the service in the end, he said just go and I don't want you in my place again!!!!! It was very clear that he bases his service on race!!!He is  a very disgusting racist man and we are definitely not coming to this place never again!!!

83qeH-6I5URzXBcaVTGkbA.text: Went there after a tiresome day of walking around. Staff was very accommodating in getting us a table.  We ordered a lot of food and they didn't disappoint.  Naan was good. Mast o moosir and mirza ghasemi were heavenly. Kabob was good too but the style was a bit different than I am used to. Staff was great and very friendly! We had a great chat with one of them.  The spot is tucked in with other restaurants. Really liked it.

Qwj0bBKaOlOFC8qYSJHEBA.text: My wife and I came here on a Sunday night for dinner and we had a nice experience.  We were seated in an outside under a heat lamp and it was nice because the restaurant is in a cool part of London with lots of foot traffic.  My only complaints would be that it took about 10 minutes for a waiter to come by and take our orders and that there were a lot of people smoking on the street, so if you're bothered by cigarette smoke, request to sit inside.  We really enjoyed the food, and I'd highly recommend the minced lamb.

W2Y_oTEbglB1Y1Ra7YzFHQ.text: Not Recommended!  PRO's:  Good in-house-made bread & 1 single good waiter (didn't get his name but he's a slender Egyptian young man with black glasses on);  CON's:  simple beef filet-and-kobedah  absolutely of low quality;  shallot-and-yogurt was below standard;  homemade dough  was not even close to a C grade!  Maybe because we are for Southern California where the quality of Iranian Restaurants rival their counterparts in Iran but, for London we expected at least an over "B" grade of a quality here!  We got C- and worse, a " D" if it wasn't for the 1 really good waiter who was trying real hard!

80UZyEQvCEGTuQloqf1UAw.text: What a pleasant surprise.  Iran Restaurant is old-fashioned in a comforting way, time seems to have stood still here for a few decades.  My friend and I were reluctant at first as staff were a little bit too keen to pull in diners from the walkway ...  they even brought out the owner to have a word with us and somehow he managed to sweettalk us into taking a table inside - all the windows were wide open on this nice summer's evening.  The outside tables were taken by a family and by a big group of Arab men feasting on a shared meal.We were worried that we'd end up with too much food and a massive bill but prices were actually very reasonable and they were happy to accommodate our small appetites.  We shared a couple of mezze starters and a traditional Person main course of chicken stewed in a rich walnut and pomegranade sauce.  We had a lovely evening with the sweet smell of shisha pipes wafting in through the open windows - a bit like being on holiday in an exotic country.

JsuBX9QT5kXURymL_RlsYQ.text: Great service, authentic food, and nice atmosphere. Traditional Persian cuisine at a reasonable price and good size portions.

AVsVSXrUqtPk_h2It-48xQ.text: Wonderful food!  Amazing service!!  Javad went out of his way to make sure we were enjoying our dinner.  We didn't have reservation but got a wonderful table.  I would highly recommend Iran.

Ib4U69x4MMAKNtufA2Nj9A.text: It was a very nice Persian cuisine. The food was absolutely awesome. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who would love to have a nice dinner for one night.

LP0SJuqT6wU8pB8UGAaDaw.text: Quite possibly the best Iranian restaurant I've ever been to outside of Iran. The owner was fantastic. The service was second to none. The food was excellent. There was no shortness of dishes. There was a total of 7 of us... we had 12 dishes.... not a single dish disappointed. I would highly recommend this restaurant in Mayfair. One of the best meals in London. Koobideh kabob was excellent. Thank you.

e0MEgB4nhQmFBXwopB2s7w.text: This place was incredible! All the starters are absolutely delicious, and the naan served with them is made fresh. I had one of the lamb kabobs and it was hands down the best lamb I've ever had. The owner was sitting nearby and asked how we were enjoying everything, and gave us some tea and small baklava on the house. Such great hospitality and amazing food! I absolutely recommend!

hoYvgfHkAq4JFTkuTYM2Sg.text: Terrible food.  Terrible service.  One menu for the table?  Honestly get it together.  Menu looked enticing but the pictures online were not true.  Quite disappointing

Vo0Ci6jBakzadAWkjL_k4A.text: The best Iranian food in London..Good grill kabab and nice seafood ..I have been here many times..I advise you to come here .. and i from Qatar most my family visit this restaurant.. QATAR

tzkCR2Jd2yvIfC5lF4V_pA.text: Best Persian restaurant in London! The food was exceptional, as was the service. Had a very enjoyable lunch here. I ordered the chicken kebab and it was very succulent and tasty. The naan bread was delicious and huge! We were given complimentary hummus. I recommend the Salad Olivier - one of the best I've ever had. The service was next to none. The waiter was attentive but not overbearing. The atmosphere was great. Make sure you have the chai and bakalawa to finish off! A must visit in London.

qZcAkoyaAdRJkB9zO5beSA.text: This place has wonderful and a great atmosphere. I would recommend this place for a large group or an intimate evening. The owner and service is second to none. The dishes were all wonderful. Don't miss out on this experience.

mgAxZtb9iBKjLq8TqIZq-Q.text: Came all the way here from Los Angeles. Reza and Mehdi instantly became family. The atmosphere was... dare I say.... exquisite. Located in the "kooche pas kooche's" of London, this cute restaurant excelled in their service, food preparation and cleanliness. Would recommend to everyone!!!!

2JiU6p5Wr0J_BlEWWYZcdw.text: Excellent food and excellent service. The appetizer alone deserves a visit. Very unique flavor. Sophisticated ambiance. I loved it!

S0r7xcEL7_VuolzGyIqxqw.text: This restaurant is epic. It is located in an awesome place at Shepard Market. Ambience is great, and service is fantastic. Definitely order the pomegranate dish or the sour prune stew.Highly recommend.

F6oFydbFBvzwWuh307pPVg.text: We came here because it had 4.5 stars and we were really disappointed. Admittedly, I ordered the chicken kebab, so maybe I should have ordered something else, but it was 17 pounds and it wasn't that much better than something more fast service. The wine wasn't good, and we ordered waters for the table, but they never brought them, yet still charged us for them...Evian :(

rJGjKvQ6YGCGru3TvlqlLg.text: Love how this small but quaint restaurant is tucked away in an alley away from the busy Piccadilly street in London.  Iran Restaurant... that's clear!A bit hard to find but that was part of the fun! It was actually located next to other small other pubs and restaurants off the hustle and bustle of the tourists' grid. The fresh nan bread was on the house... delish!!!!!! ...and it came with hummus that did not disappoint.Service was excellent and didn't have to wait too long before my order was served. Overwhelming size for a starving customer!Perfect place to take your spouse or a date night with someone special.  Wish my wife were here....

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

5fr8RsiktTuE8lp24OBJSA.text: We went to this restaurant after searching for Mediterranean food on yelp. We thoroughly enjoyed the meal and were made to feel welcome by the staff.The owner took the time to ask if we were familiar with the cusine and offered several suggestions.Everything he recommended was outstanding and we will be back again.

6vjxzdK4RM-aVJu4xofW4A.text: We came here on a friend's recommendation. What a delicious little place! We came for dinner in March and sat outside under the heat lamps. Menu standouts were the naan and lentil soup. Service was excellent, my husband ordered a sambuca and when they were out of it, our waiter offered him a cognac on the house. I had a piping hot fresh mint tea with baklava for dessert--fantastic.If I lived in London, I would be a regular at Iran!

0QR7TG_nn729--A-T9OvkA.text: I'd never had Persian food before, so had NO idea what to order. Luckily a kind gentleman at the table next to me happened to run the place and ordered for me. In Iranian. Yep, this place is the real deal.The starter was a freshly baked flat bread with two dipping sauces - one yogurt/spinach/garlic sauce and one bean-tomato sauce. I mentioned that I like spicy food, but the gentleman said that other cuisines use spice to cover up the flavor, and he was right. There was SOOO much flavor in everything I tried, and none of it spicy. The flavors were deep and complex and totally incomparable to Indian or Moroccan or anything else I've tried.The main course was a lamb "stew" in a coriander sauce. A surprising kick were dried lemons re-softened by simmering in the sauce. They added a bright citrus flavor and just melted in my mouth.The gentleman gave me a piece of his grilled lamb to try, and it was also amazing - and this is coming from someone who doesn't especially like lamb.The service was wonderful, the experience of just trying whatever was recommended to me was unforgettable, and the "discovery" of a new-to-me cuisine was enlightening. There's a reason this place is routinely named among the best Persian restaurants in London, and I know I'll be telling all my friends about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Bread with dipping sauces

vHz5btQVxzBu9-ZhjitNFQ.text: I came to Mayfair from NYC and had to stop by Iran Restaurant. Excellent hospitality, great kabob koobideh and lovely environment.

YsjqooebPH3JiiyIJIowgg.text: Great food and great service!! The host seated us promptly on the table we wanted outside, even though it was a big table and there were only 2 of us and he could have saved it for a bigger party as it was quite busy. But made up for it by the amount of food we ordered because we wanted to try everything. Loved it all!

ycDjWlQv8J2ZlkRDAQgAfQ.text: My mom and I came here while in London on vacation and we had such an amazing experience! Order the ghameh and joojeh kebab. The owner is so sweet and took care of us. Everything was delicious and the service was impeccable

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

W9imPgsfvIjeMa00uMMx9Q.text: Great service with amazing food which is a unique combination close to great pubs.I can highly recommend this restaurant!

neIu_MNQ_qe3PePHxacapA.text: Great restaurant and great food. Service was exceptional! Very very fresh!!! Mouth watering chicken!

Cc3roKyinHTR6pdFomNKaw.text: Very very good Iranian restaurant, I couldn't stop eating the chicken although I was stuffed!!!I recommend it for anyone who wants to try Iranian food. Book before going as they are always full!

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Sultan I chicken and lamb with rice and salad, n37 in the menu

19-aZuMaYCIriG9NnDc9QQ.text: One of the BEST persian food I have ever had. They have fresh bread. In fact they make it in front of you. Appetizers and main dish were incredible. I've been to sooo many persian restaurants but this is not comparable. The service was very good and the owner and other staff were were nice and friendly. I am really happy I found this restaurant. Oh also don't forget to drink the persian tea at the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

YL80Iwo5Yxo9CqRK1wxgrQ.text: Delicious and great service. Never had Iranian food and loved it. Service was great as well. Let them help pick your food, really enjoyed it.

uPy5Tc6YkM0DRkMYsayhSA.text: The food here is so, SO good. The bread is awesome, anything lamb is a win, and while the service is a bit slow, our waiter was excellent.I would have given 5 stars but there was a bit of a kerfuffle upon arriving, even after making a reservation. We were given a table outside which I wasn't too pleased about but fortunately there was very little cigarette smoking outside which made the dinner a pleasure.I would definitely go back here - the food really is amazing.

LqZeSXikimkReUP1NAWcgg.text: Great food in a relaxed setting. The location is slightly off the beaten track, tucked around the corner from the main square. Will definitely visit again next time I'm in London

photos.caption: Photo of Iran Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

ogbF5zfjFlmpg75kheO-oA.text: After searching for a place to eat dinner for over an hour, we were lucky enough to come across Iran Restaurant. We are well aware of what Fine Persian Cuisine should be and this definitely meets expectations! The ambiance, food, and staff are all wonderful! Everything from the fresh bread to the main entrees are fresh and delicious!

ex-ID-kyOBbBnp-EhFYtuw.text: We were coming back from Stonehenge and we were very hungry. We wanted to try something new and came across the highly reviewed restaurant. Mosan was quick to seat us and quickly made some recommendations. He suggested the mixed grill and we were not disappointed. The stews has very good flavors. The meats were cooked to perfection. Great hospitality! Great Service! And great food. Trifecta!

RR2usyJD3OuWp5GHRTz81A.text: The Service is good, the place is nice, but the food is the worst persian food I have ever had...As my wife is Iranian, wherever we go, we try Persian Restaurants...because of the good reviews on yelp, we decided to go here while in London.The starters were okay, but not more...the main courses were so fat and the lamb filet smelled like really old meat...Sorry, but I cannot recommend this Restaurant at all...

DR7b267BqLIxlfxZsG8yfg.text: Excellent and big portions of food, lovely service and great ambience. The recommendations by the waiters were spot on and the food tasted delicious. The portions were so big that they packed it into tupperware and I was able to get another whole meal out of it.Even though the food is a bit pricey, it is definitely worth paying for. Me and my friends even got free tea at the end of our evening, stayed past closing times and chatted with the staff. Definitely would recommend! 5/5 stars
